Review.Titre: Don't sign up unless you are sure
Review.Contenu: I signed up for a trial account and tried to cancel before my first billing cycle.  The link internally on the portal to cancel is "broken" and has been for at least 6 months.  I thought I had canceled my account. I had asked for it to be canceled and 6 months later they are still charging me.  My advice: look at RingCentral instead.

Absolutely ridiculous, I signed one month contract and then I realised they keept charging me from JUNE. I contacted them on multiple channels and apart from being reassured that they will cancel my account nothing happend and I got charged once again.

Review.Titre: Kept charging my creditcard after I had previously requested a refund and did not continue with trial
Review.Contenu: I tried dialpad. I told them I would not proceed. Kept charging my credit card after I had previously requested a refund and did not continue with trial.

Review.Titre: Did you get a free trial? Don't get scammed.
Review.Contenu: If you are exploring a free trial with Dialpad, be warned: at the end of the 14-day trial, you are automatically upgraded to a paid account without an opt-in or email notification.Their Customer Success team refused to give a refund-- even a pro-rated refund.I'm our company's CTO and was excited to use them, but they are difficult to do business with. It looks like we'll be using OpenPhone.

Review.Titre: The rudest sales team I ever…
Review.Contenu: The rudest sales team I ever encountered. I mean the arrogance and the lack of support for a client who is in the process of registering is bewildering. What if I'd had already paid them and worked with them how would that support be then?Laughable company!

I took Dialpad's service two months ago, their website clearly states that unlimited calls. Yesterday they cancelled my account by saying that your usage is more. What a pathetic service. I request not to take their service, They are lying. Support request # 2961225The service which I was told about before using was said to be unlimited even on their website it’s clearly mentioned that it’s unlimited usage, but my account has been cancelled due to usage without any prior intimation and no one emailed me /called me to inform about the usage. Yesterday when I posted my review then one of Their representatives contacted me via email his name is Dulce, he said he will review my case and will get back to me but I haven’t received any updates from him till yet and my account has not been activated.I will go to every extent to pursue my case.

First there software is BROKEN, not unfinished that would be too good a compliment it's outright broken.Nothing in my trial worked. I ended up calling them to cancel my account for 2 days later to be bombarded with more zendesk tickets telling ME to cancel my own account. Go there on my PC and it's a white page (500 server error) to cancel. I've never experienced such a crappy company all year, it's disgusting. Oh and day after I signed up, I was emailed the next day, I replied asking for assistance and never heard anything back. Don't waste your time, these "positive" reviews are fake as far as I am concerned the software is broken and their service is a shamblesEdit: No I will not be forced to waste my time any further because you simply don't like my review. Pay me for my time or do one! I am not telling you what you have done wrong on my time. Do your own research!

Review.Titre: Horrible customer service and no sense of urgency
Review.Contenu: Signed up for service a month ago and still can't text. Have sent corporate paperwork and contacted onboarding and customer service several times with no help. They were quick to take money for a service we can't even use yet. They are holding up business and don't seem to care. This was suppose to take only 10 days and we are way past that with no set timeline now.***UPDATE*** Forwarded info to the director in response to my original review and still NOTHING. Not even a response. They will continue to take your money for a service that isn't even usable with absolutely not ETA....

Review.Titre: Adrien was incredible! BUT THERE ARE GLITCHES!
Review.Contenu: Adrien was incredible! But Dialpad's online portal is horrible.I am a solo entrepreneur that has an urgent need for a cloud based calling service to help my business. I was unable to start my account due to glitches in their system. After spending close to 30 minutes on the phone with Dialpad, calling my bank to make sure my card was ok, opening 3 different web browsers, and multiple emails I was unable to sign up. Poor experience. Thanks Dialpad! I went to Aircall instead.

Review.Titre: Do not purchase if you are a UK company…
Review.Contenu: Do not purchase if you are a UK company looking to make calls in the US.They oversold the product stating that we could do this, although when we went to add more users they said we have to be a US company to do it. Very disingenuous. Customer service was not helpful.

Hi I was happy with my Dialpad account worked great until I tried to cancel it,It seems impossible to cancel I’ve been trying for 6 weeks to date and my account is still active,I’ve spoken to over 15 different people from there and sent 4 emails requesting that my account needs to be cancelled and I’ve had 4 ticket numbers but still no joy,I’ve called my credit card company to see if they can stop any further payments but they can’t it needs to be Dialpad that closes the account and I can’t see how that’s possible,So if you committed to staying with Dialpad I highly recommend them as long as you never leave and try to cancel,This is actually the first review I’ve ever left I’m just so frustrated not sure what else to do

Do not under any circumstances use this company , you will regret it . They will charge you for services that were not agreed and will lie about what is actually in their packages . And when you call them the staff are rude , incompetent , and will not resolve your problem , they will just Pam you off till your next bill where they will over charge you again , SCAM COMPANY OUT TO ROB PEOPLE !!!!!!

Having trouble setting up text messages, unable to speak to support. You can only speak to a human if you are buying, not available if you need support. Generated multiple support tickets, zero response. Unable to cancel subscription, when you try to cancel from admin console. The system prompts you to generate another ticket. Pathetic experience, stay away from DialPad. FYI we have been using RingCentral, tried dial pad because RingCentral doesn’t offer SMS service in our region.Hi DulceI have replied to your message and despite your escalation, still no one has bothered to reach out.

Dialpad has the worst support I've ever encountered. I chatted with a sales rep who was wonderful. They assured me their service would work with my existing hardware and checked that my number was portable. They even offered me an excellent discount to purchase. I signed up for an annual plan and ported my number. During porting, I had to contact them because they emailed to say that the port failed. Then they said it hadn't and it was a mistake. The number seems to work, but I'm concerned. Then, I attempted to connect my phone. I followed all the steps in their process and got an error. I tried it several times. The onscreen instructions say to send your device's MAC address to support, so I did this and explained the problem. They sent me a copy/paste of the help document and process I'd just done 3 times.I wrote back to explain that I'd done this and was still getting an error. I received back a copy/paste of the help doc and the process I'd already followed. I called in, and they were going to escalate it to their technical team and respond via email. Guess what? I got a copy/paste of the help doc. Stay away from this company. They may be inexpensive, but if you ever need help with your service, you won't get it. Now, I'm trying to get my number ported back and hoping for a refund, but I expect it to be a fight.

Horrible company with horrible customer service. I spent over a week simply trying to get an account set up. Their platform throws constant errors in which you have to contact support to get an explanation of the error and they never give you an answer,Stay away from this company!

While the interface is good and fairly intuitive, the quality and reliability have been a consistent problem over our months of use. Whether from a mobile device or PC, calls drop, there are periods of dead air and some voicemails are texts are extremely hard to locate later. As a small business, an unreliable phone system is a deal breaker and I'm checking out other vendors.

Review.Titre: You managed to max out the level of how…
Review.Contenu: You managed to max out the level of how annoying repetition any youtube advert ever did since Roman times, your french exuberance made sure for generations non of my gran gran gran gran children will ever use dial pad, and we will burn down any diaLPAD villages we ever see in our paths. Congratulation to have taken your vagina and rub it in my face for the 45000x times, i am not interested, get of my D with your dialPAD for losers, no surprise you get zero love.To a response from your company that belives I will waste my time emailing. Are you low IQ or you can not read well. I just wrote that you played your YOUTUBE advert for 450.000 time and looking at the same annoying lady and same stupid youtube advert, means you are so dumb at the advertising and your repsonse to trust pilot review is even worse.

Absolute mess, once the contract is signed, they disappear, there is no demo, no guidance how to proceed with the process. I really want to simply pay & start using the tool as my team is waiting for it to be resolved. I have been asking a support center and my account manager who gives no relevant information to the customer for a week now to resolve my issue and start to use the tool.

Review.Titre: If you have a large office with…
Review.Contenu: If you have a large office with multiple sites, this is not an option for your business. Our three offices have been in limbo for 6 months because we wanted desk phones not tied to employees. They cannot accommodate this structure, nor can they connect the phones to transfer internally. You must use an app. which is not feasible for our large multi location office. We still get charged for phones that do not work.

Review.Titre: A nice UX design with a terrible engine behind
Review.Contenu: We have been clients with call centers, talk etc for years. We have put up with their service issues, lack of features, months of delays and misrepresentations. We are constantly suffering issues like calls not connecting, numbers blocked, lack of features and a ton of other staff.This company and service is NOT equiped to provide service as call centers. Stay away and you will save yourself a ton of frustration. We are currently paying about 3K a month.. terrible tool, don't let yourself fool by the startupy, modern UX, etc.. this is a piece of...   However, if you want to get it for you as a single user (dialpad talk) it may work but don't think this will work for any remotely professional call center operation.

Review.Titre: Scam service - simply DO NOT use
Review.Contenu: My account was sold to me with full flexibility to add and remove users and numbers.  I made it a key point of the process as that was what I had with my previous supplier so that I can add as we grow and remove costs if the business need changes... Then contract is for 3 years and with no ability remove once someone is added - WHY would anyone sign up to such a deal?Also promised call recording and review - not provided and Dialpad meeting but again this isn't offered as the main service is only available in the US...Then to add insult to injury my "account manager" reached out to resolve the issues and has since left without anyone replacing her.  So I'm now stuck with a contract, no means to discuss issues with Dialpad and on-going charges for a missold agreement

Am I hallucinating this hellscape?My fleet wasn't able to send inbound or outbound messages. Thus, I sent the company a scathing email asking them to cancel my account and detailing everything that was wrong with the product. Today, I get an email THANK YOU FOR RENEWING DIALPAD!!!! Did you purposely ignore my request to cancel? Furthermore, when you call the San Jose number to get support, it politely tells you that you cannot get support and there is nowhere else to get support. Then, when you contact the automated chatbot, nothing goes through there either. Good luck canceling! WOW! Chargeback city, baby. Switched to google voice and never, ever ever going back. I'm actually extremely disappointed because I'm one of the people that worked on the partnership with Google and I thought this product was better. They sold it for better than what it actually was. Google should sever ties, IMO. Would never have signed off on this partnership if I knew this was how the service actually was here.

Review.Titre: Poor quality product with low level…
Review.Contenu: Poor quality product with low level functionality and horrendous customer service. It’s taken us 4 months to try and leave them. Stay away. We’re now with Aircall who seem far better.

Review.Titre: The worst customer service I've ever…
Review.Contenu: The worst customer service I've ever encountered.I signed up for a trial account but before I could even use the software my account was blocked. After wasting an hour talking to customer support who just fobbed me off with vague answers I received an email to say my account has been permanently terminated because suspicious activity has been detected.How can suspicious activity be detected when I only just signed up?The only suspicious activity I see is from Dialpad, who took my debit card details before telling me I'm 'not allowed' to use the software.I will look elsewhere for call forwarding solutions for my travel company.AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS.

Review.Titre: Barely works and zero customer service
Review.Contenu: We used DialPad for our mid-sized company with dozens of phone lines for well over a year. They had absolutely horrible service, it never worked right, had constant bugs and no one could ever help with any of the issues. Just endless email loops and excuses. We would come in one day and find that they had dropped numbers from our account and there would be no new ones in their place and we just wouldn't get calls from our clients that week, or we would realize that all the analytics data was nearly worthless since it was so buggy. They also overbilled us almost monthly (often by hundreds or thousands of dollars), which always took hours to get them to admit that they made a mistake and correct it. After dealing with dozens of similar issues we parted ways and would definitely not consider them again.

Review.Titre: Terrible customer service provided by Jowalsh Ortega
Review.Contenu: I forgot to cancel the subscription after we stopped using the services and they kept on charging for 9 months. When we finally realized 9 months down the road that we are being charged for services we do not use anymore, dialpad did not have the courtesy to partially refund us even a single month.
bad app..Charged 4x more than advertised.No option to delete or cancel the subscription they take the money and charged me already 2 times..No customer service.. no replay to delete the account

Terrible experience. Signed up and immediately had my account terminated before I was able to log into my account. When I contacted support, they said the billing department had locked me out. After taking hours to get back to me, the billing department said my account had been cancelled due to violation of their policies and accused me of "fraudulent activity," but provided no details on what the alleged "fraudulent activity" was or how it happened before I had even logged into my account.Called customer service the next day and they were not able to help, provide any direction on how to proceed, or tell me what happened.
terrible company, cancelled my acconut, no one can help, cant find my address, cant set up or reactivate account,,,, spent hours trying to sort it outridicilous

I signed up for a trial (with a debit card). the same day I wanted to cancel my account, but you can't, you need to contact support. I requested a cancellation via support, but they can't cancel my account, they need to escalate your request and open a ticket, so someone else starts to reply to your emails/ticket with everything possible less give you a cancellation of your trial. They ask questions that are not necessary to cancel an account, then they send you an email offering a meeting, then they offer you a discount when I have replied to EVERY email from dialpad saying I just want them to CANCEL my account.4 days have passed since my request, and I have been replying to emails from Dialpad every day, and they still don't cancel my account.This is not a trial, this is a scam.

Super Cheats! I took 2 numbers for outbound calls under the pro plan and it was mentioned that you can do unlimited calling using the pro plan. The price of the pro plan is US$35 per month. Its not mentioned anywhere that to make outbound calls you need to take the "sell" plan. They activated the "sell" plan and charged US$300 on my card after the trial period.

Review.Titre: A lie of omission is still a lie.
Review.Contenu: I needed a phone for Multi-Factor Authentication at work. My old phone died and my new one was taking longer to ship than expected. I thought the Dialpad free trial would work to fill the interim. I was wrong. Despite making no mention of a daily limit on the website, I had quickly burned through my allotted time just trying to setup MFA and my account was disabled. I had to pay up just to be able to log into work. I wouldn't have minded so much if the page advertising the free trial had bothered mentioning the limits to the trial. But there was no mention of a daily minute limit. The only limit mentioned on the trial page is a 14 day limit for the trial period. I even looked in the terms of service and found no mention of a specific daily minute limit. They do reserve the right to cancel an account for any reason without warning, which they did to me when they noticed I was reaching an arbitrary limit that had not been disclosed to me at any point. That's just deceptive business right there.

Review.Titre: Do it yourself, they won't help you!
Review.Contenu: I signed up for the free trial under a monthly plan.I had forgotten about the date as i spent hours trying to get someone to do the onboarding with me but they never had a time that worked with me. The features look promising BUT in all fairness I did not get a chance to use them. At the end of the free trial they charged me a yearly rate when I wa on the monthly plan. I contacted them to try to work it out as I am not happy with my current provider. Since they could not get anyone to help with the onboarding, we agreed to cancel with a refund. It has been over a week and no refund issued. I reached out to them by chat and said if er can complete onboarding TODAY then we would be willing to discuss the service(i mean it was already paid for). they did not even answer me after that. Well their plan of using the policies as written to fight a chargeback will not work with me because I have it in writing that they would issue a refund and have NOT! Again, the service looks really promising BUT the customer service is the worst I have ever seen!

Miserable experience. I left another provider to come to Dialpad because I was unsatisfied with the customer service and experience I was having with the original company. Let me just tell you, I am now RUNNING back to my original provider with open arms. It's absolutely amazing when you look at how much $ this company has spent and how poorly designed of a product they actually have. I had a positive experience with customer service for the most part and call quality was not really an issue, but the software they built, functionality, versality, flexibility, ingenuity is HORRIBLE. They should be embarrassed. There are basic features and functions that you would think they would have released in an early beta and yet their software has been around for quite awhile now and still lack these features. It's no wonder they're based out of California. Just like their state gov't they charge you more than anyone else and yet can't even deliver basic amenities or quality of life.

Review.Titre: Long time Dialpad Customer- stay far away
Review.Contenu: Stay far away if can. Customer of Dialpad since 2020. They have been increasing our price drastically, removed the ability for us to downgrade or remove seats, and are holding us hostage by charging us for more than double the users we have using the platform. We had someone on our team create "Sell" seats and entered in more than we needed. Dialpad removed our ability completely to downgrade those seats. Somehow we have double the seats than we have employees and we flagged this to them 9 months ago. They said they would fix it. They keep increasing our price and billing us more. I've escalated this and no one will help. Clearly struggling with churn so they just make it impossible for you. We weren't even looking at moving away, we just wanted our account to be accurate to the seats and not overpay by double. Multiple people on their team have told us they would remove unnecessary users from our account and no one ever follows up to make it happen. We've been dealing with this for over 9 months and have been paying them $25k/year.

Seems real scammy. I cancelled in February and see a notice that I’ve been charged in March so I check and I’ve been charged TWICE. I email them directly from their email to dispute this charge and it says the email is invalid. I never trust companies that make you jump hoops to get your money back. They also have this sketchy 3 day refund rule. I just want my $71.96 ASAP because after reading the rest of these comments this company is low key trash.

I signed up for a free trial and forgot to cancel (which allegedly 40%+ of people generally do). After I was charged for a 1 month subscription, I emailed support requesting a refund and cancellation. Then I was charged again the following month! Since I didn't type out a reason for my initial cancellation request for charge #1, they didn't process the cancellation for charge #2! So I emailed support and typed out an explanation why I'm discontinuing their services (i.e. no longer invested in sales calls industry).Month 3 comes and I was charged again! So I went from forgetting to cancel my free trial to getting charged for 3 months (in addition to the time cost of sending 2 email requests to cancel.)Instead of emailing Dialpad a third time to request a cancellation, I saved time by contacting my bank to block future charges from Dialpad. This action would have saved me time and money after charge #1.Perhaps Dialpad intentionally makes it difficult to cancel subscription requests as part of their business strategy? It's much easier to unsubscribe from spam text messages with a simple reply such as: Stop

Review.Titre: Download of audio sessions does not…
Review.Contenu: Download of audio sessions does not work any longer.Still experiencing voice issues and very disturbing background. It's pretty difficult to quickly identify who's making noise making it difficult to quickly mute them...

Review.Titre: why don't you have a cancel button?
Review.Contenu: why don't you have a cancel button?Your rep got back asking for a support code.  Why do people need to go thru these extra steps just to cxl a trial acct?For the past 10 yrs the system has spammed me.   if client doesn't need the system allow them to remove the acct easily. Please verify your support code for this request. To find your Support Code, please log in to dialpad.com/  settings,  navigate to your profile, and scroll down until you see Support Code below Timezone. May I know the reason for the cancellation? If you are switching to another service, would you be able to tell us who you are switching to? Your comments are appreciated!Best,AdrianDialpad, Inc. | Dialpad Meetings

Review.Titre: They are absolutely awful. They lie and offer SUBPAR support.
Review.Contenu: They are absolutely awful. What I agreed to signed up for isn't what was delivered. It is going on 3 months and they are experiencing "technical issues" that are preventing me from utilizing the phone service. I would NEVER recommend this company to anyone.

Review.Titre: I've had Uberconference for 2 years and…
Review.Contenu: I've had Uberconference for 2 years and have been waiting patiently for them to catch up with the rest of the pack.  The last straw is the fact that they do not have video capability for Apple mobile devices.  This is ridiculous.  I then asked them for my money back and they refused.  They even would not allow me to take down my credit card while my account is still active.  Uberconference is truly the worst of the pack.  DO NOT  GET TRAPPED BY THEM!
Terrible - site makes you work REALLY hard to just log in - pages are unclear and, despite spending 45 minutes with 2 different advisors, neither were able to help get me set up. I gave up

Review.Titre: Now 3 months on and still having…
Review.Contenu: Now 3 months on and still having problems with dialpad , joke company!!! Worst customer service ever!!!

Review.Titre: Turned off our sms features while we…
Review.Contenu: Turned off our sms features while we were still simply asking questions about it. Really unprofessional.

Review.Titre: The service with dialpad never really worked…
Review.Contenu: The service with dialpad never worked very well. Not only did we miss calls but it was difficult to use. We tried canceling but they acted "confused" only to find out they increased our plan (ie. more money) without telling us. Good thing we caught it and got out. Zoom phone is easier

DialPad are liars.  I specifically called them after receiving an email notification of the price increase of more than 15% for continued service.  They assured me that my account was not going to be effected by this increase and it was going to remain the same amount.  Lie number one.  I called after the increase and the charge was more than previously paid.  They assured me it was an error and they would provide me a credit and sorry for the misunderstanding.  I was charged ever more the next month.  Lie number two.  I call about it and share that I do not want to continue and that I have began searching for another provider.  "Oh so sorry, please don't leave.  We'll fix it." was their response.  HELL NO.After finding another provider and paying to have their service and starting the port of my phone number to them, DialPad would not release the phone number causing me to not only have to pay for a month of service with the new company, but now I've lost the number altogether because I told them to cancel the service after they BILLED ME AGAIN the higher amount NOT AGREED UPON and I was lied to in the past twice.Tech is okay- 3 stars. Customer service is -1 star.

ABDOLUTELY ABYSMAL. After paying £600 for a pro licence for 3 people, a week ago they decided to turn off my ability to be able to send SMS texts. Since this is my primary communication medium with my customers they have killed my company. After numerous calls numerous emails backwards and forwards over 6 days they keep telling me it's because I've run out of credit. My account does not run on credit, it runs on unlimited calls and unlimited texts. Strangely I am allowed to send texts to American numbers but not the UK numbers when I'm a UK based company. It seems obvious that someone in the system thinks that I'm a US customer rather than a UK customer but do they take that information in and run with it? No, they keep repeatedly over and over and over again telling me I've run out of credits and I have to buy more credits for $180. They kept telling me it's what the billing department had told them, so I called and I pressed number 2 to speak to the billing department after wasting 30 minutes explaining the tragic story of what the hell had gone on, the lady then told me to hang on a minute I'll just talk to the billing department, so the stupid system put me through to technical support when I specifically press number 2 to talk to billing. OMG. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. THEY ARE ROBOTS WITH NO ABILITY TO SORT OUT ISSUES.UPDATE 25/2 - They messaged here and told me to email Dulce. I did. 2 days later, no response. This is typical of this terrible company. Words are cheap.

BUYER BEWARE - Having had various problems with dialpad after spending over £600 with them. I tripped over the latest insanity today. I tried calling an 0844 number (UK Border Agency) (7p/minute) and the system told me I didn't have enough credit (I had £10 of credit). I called support. First they told me its becasue that number charges £20/minute. I told them thats obviously not correct. Then was told it cost £7/minute, to which I told them the "p" in 7p/minute is not pounds but pence. Then I was told that I was not allowed to call  premium rate numbers - becasue I need to pay for 15 licenses before they would "enable" that!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Did they tell me when I paid my £600 up front "Just so you are aware sir, there will of course be certain numbers that it will be impossible for you to call" Of course not, becasue that would mean I would not have used them or paid them any money.ABSOLUTE INSANITY.Read their reply. A misunderstanding! Everything has to be some kind of insane conversation with these people. Then when u expose it, its just a misunderstanding! What they should say, is, "we are terribly sorry sir it's obviously insane for us to force you to buy 15 licenses in order to be able to make phone calls to premium rate numbers. I'll get that sorted out immediately, and I'm sorry for any inconvenience m. Please accept this £10 credit as a gesture of goodwill and as evidence of our commitment to not do insane things in the future" But no, they continue with their political bullsh*t of "there was a misunderstanding". ABSOLUTELY INSANE!

I joined uberconference specifically because they held out that you could place outgoing phone calls from within a conference call.  This is untrue, as verified by customer service.  Very disappointing.SEE www. uberconference .com/features/conference_call_out

I don't have anything particularly positive to say unfortunately. The product appears to be good on mobile, although the website UI is an incredibly confusing mess. It seems to be targeted towards bigger organizations vs small businesses.Either way, I signed up to a free trial and had the intention of porting a number in. Since you can't do this during the free trial, you are prompted to complete the upgrade. The price shown was 180/year + "taxes and fees", however there was no transparency around what exactly these taxes and fees would be. It didn't show me ANYWHERE on the page in terms of the full total during this upgrade. I proceed with the upgrade, only to find out I was charged $287 of the $180/year that was shown to me. Over $100 in taxes and fees which were not shown to me whatsoever.Since being charged this amount almost a week ago, I have had absolutely zero luck with speaking to anyone about getting a refund as per their payment and refund policy. If you call their billing department, there is no-one available to speak. I left a voicemail and no-one called me back. If you ask on live chat, they claim it can only be done by email.When I finally get escalated to an email thread with someone from "Customer Success", I STILL do not have a refund I asked for repeatedly. The conversation has proceeded like this:Me: Hello. I would like a refund... (with my reasoning)Dialpad: What is wrong with the product?Me: I feel mislead with the pricing. Please refund.Dialpad: What about a discount instead?Me: I just want a refund. Please process the refund as per your policyDialpad: Are you sure you want a refund? Is there something we can do?Me: I just want a refund.Dialpad: No responseStill no refund. I can't speak to anyone about getting the refund, and now I am going to have to file a chargeback. What a joke.

Review.Titre: Very difficult to get everyone setup to…
Review.Contenu: Very difficult to get everyone setup to use Uber Conference on their phones, computers and tablets.

This company's performance has been highly unsatisfactory, ranking it among the worst in my experience. Despite assuring us of free SMS to Canada and USA during the duration of our contract, they abruptly began charging us. Obtaining the promised services has been an ongoing battle, as their sales team initially made extravagant promises. The presence of hidden fees adds to the complications, making it financially burdensome. Communicating with their customer service is nothing short of a mockery. I endured a 30-minute wait on hold, only to be neglected by the agent, who failed to check in with me even once. When attempting to cancel our services, we were merely transferred to an answering machine, further exemplifying their lack of commitment to customer satisfaction.Their software proves to be plagued with significant issues, particularly for medium-sized contact centers. Multiple contacts with the same number can be created, resulting in chaotic and disorganized records. Merging these contacts is not an option, and there is no functionality to add a number to a Do Not Call (DNC) list. Furthermore, managing multiple contact centers becomes an arduous task due to the absence of a consolidated view, forcing users to navigate between multiple screens to access queues. Timekeeping for agents is also disorganized, with a messy system that requires additional upsells to another company, incurring an extra charge of $30 per seat. Real-time statistics per agent are inaccessible, as generating a report necessitates a 24-hour wait. The software's numerous flaws, such as these, contribute to daily frustrations and difficulties. It is evident that the software is being developed by individuals lacking firsthand experience in call center management.
Horrible customer service and impossible to actually get a refund on services as they describe on their site.

Review.Titre: Stay away if honesty matters to you
Review.Contenu: Stay away if honesty matters to you! Their product is good which makes this writing this difficult but they are internal practices are highly questionable.Here’s what happened to me. I had called inquiring about pricing as I was had questions and needed exact pricing. I had been burn in the past where online you see one price but when you sign up and get your invoice, it’s substantially larger.In my case, they offer me an excellent price for a one user phone plan. I explained to the sales rep on the phone I was in the business start up phase and needed to account for all expenses. All I needed was basic phone features , couldn’t care about the extras. I was very specific and asked what the total amount would be. I provided him my zip code for him to give me a total price to include taxes and fees. He quoted me $129 for the year which was a fantastic price and was slightly better than some other competitors I had been researching. That would of came out to about $11 monthly average for signing up for the yearly payment option.I said it sounds good, he even sent me the invoice on the spot for roughly $129 and I paid for it on my cell phone right then and there. After getting off the call, I noticed a charge for $227 a few hours later and was wondering if I had been double billed in error. Thinking it would resolve itself over night or even may be a temporary hold. Nope, I finally had to call. I called and they apologized, the lady said the extra amount, which came close to $100 was for fees.Fees? I specifically asked for a total that included fees and taxes. So I asked to cancel on the spot. They said that I should hear back soon. A week went by and nothing yet. Had to call again, this time the new rep was nice enough to actually cancel my account on the call. Not sure why you have to call twice to cancel an account. In my eyes, If a company can’t be transparent upfront about pricing, it makes you wonder what else they would lie to you about.Anyways, after the headache from dialpad, I went with Zoom VOIP which advertised $15 monthly, no year up front required. Their monthly price with taxes and fees is $16.24Now that’s the part that really gets me. How is Dailpad cheaper per month at around $11 but with their fees/taxes they average $18.92 ($227 / 12 months = 18.92)Where zoom is $15 and comes out to $16.24 Makes no sense as both are VOIP providers.All I got to say is shady practices, I would never recommend Dial pad to anyone I know.My recommendation to the company is that it’s a shame they use these practices. The product is fantastic but the whole experience matters. Be transparent, honest, and fourth coming. That means more to me than anything else when I put an element of my business in your hands.
Doesn't allow you to cancel subscriptions and continues to deduct money from the account.

Review.Titre: worst experience dealing with an online service in 25 years
Review.Contenu: I have been using Dialpad for ~ 15 months & although most of the support agents have been kind, responsive & helpful, both the service & their policies are not up to par, especially the service reps that handle unsatisfied customers. It appears I'm not alone, many others here agree.First, the service dropped my calls often (from the desktop app), normally about 3-4 times a month. Sometimes I could not call a number at all with no ringing after making a call or no ability to use an auto attendant (press any keys during the call). I had reported most all of those incidents to support & after 15 months, nothing was getting better or resolved. The iPhone app often would not allow me to place a call from my contact list, only if you hit the 'phone' icon in a specific area of the app (not on the contact's page) would the call initiate. The iPhone app would also lag in response, turning on or off the speaker, initiating the call or ending the call, all were delayed so often you would have to hit the icon/link several times to get it to work (or not work). The desktop app was also not stable even though I kept it updated. The VM transcriptions were wildly off.Then a few months ago I inquired about the charges and policies related to the new SMS/MMS registry. The rates on my service went up about $80 per year unannounced & the answer was 'taxes'. I spoke to customer service several times and we could never get a bottom line number of why the cost of the service went up that much without an explanation. They said it was 'taxes' & nothing could be done about that. I researched my online account, the help desk and my billing details & found nothing related to the 'taxes' and the increase & I mentioned to customer serivce that I wasn't satisfied. The first suggestion was 'did I want to cancel my service' which I found odd. I said I'd like to speak to someone before cancelling & was told I'd be contacted in a few days. I really wanted to understand why the rates went up without any notice or explanation.A week later, I was contacted by a rep named 'Julian' who emailed me and asked if I wanted to continue to cancel. He did not attempt to provide reasons why I should stay with Dialpad or even discuss my concerns. I asked to speak to someone before cancelling and he avoided the entire topic & followed up with me a few days later asking if I wanted to continue to cancel.I asked for a refund if I were to cancel because I had just renewed 2 months earlier & paid for a full year. He replied that wasn't their policy & wouldn't be possible. Only after I explained my dissatisfaction and that it was basically theft to collect for an entire year & not provide the service, he said he could request an approval for the refund.After I found an alternative service that I was happy with, I told him it would take about a week to port my numbers over and then I would reach out to him again. He emailed and asked 'would you like to cancel your service now?' and within 3 minutes of receiving that email, my service was disconnected. I never even had a chance to reply.After calling customer service and getting help from a very nice rep, she was as confused as I was why my service was disconnected without my consent. She attempted to contact 'Julian' but he would not respond to her. We stayed on the call together for a while and then she said she would follow up with me once she was able to restore my service.Please note I run a business and for this 3 hour time frame that it took to restore the service, my clients and prospects were getting a 'disconnected' message which not only refects poorly on my company (and reputation) but also cost me business.After about 3 hours my service was restored.I then contacted 'Julian' again and kindly asked him to wait on the request until the numbers were ported and then we could continue the cancellation.About 5 days later the numbers were ported and I again contacted 'Julian' to continue with the refund request authorization and cancellation. He replied and said that I was no longer qualified to request a refund. I replied to ask to speak to a manager or someone about this. I replied again, no answer. 4 days later, today, my service was canceled without any communication.Probably the worst experience dealing with a company since I've been working online, and that is 25 years now. And I don't leave negative reviews, only a handful in that time frame.Still to this day, NO ONE from Dialpad has reached out to me, asked if I would reconsider, asked what the issue was or anything relating to my service. Nothing. Even after I requested more than 4 times to be able to speak to someone about this. I did not receive a refund for the prorated service I didn't get now that my service is cancelled & paid through next March (2024). Disappointed is an understatement in this case & am considering my options at this time.

The product is tolerable, but the people working there are incapable to an amazing degree. It literally took weeks and dozens of attempts to get them to send us a new contract to renew... Not with any new terms. Just to let us renew and take our money. Apparently, they have bad enough service that no one ever renews so they don't even have a team to handle that?

Review.Titre: DIALPAD IS HOLDING MY PHONE # HOSTAGE
Review.Contenu: DIALPAD IS HOLDING MY PHONE # HOSTAGE.  I signed up for Dialpad because it integrates with my CRM and case management program. The integration worked well and that's the only good thing I have to say. I have been trying to get my phone # ported out since December 13th. Today is the 31st.  They keep denying the port out saying the pin doesn't match, YET their reps keep giving me the pin.  I am stuck with a sub par phone system that is costing me business and THEY WON'T RELEASE MY PHONE THAT I HAVE HAD FOR 25 YEARS.

From the first interaction with Dialpad, I was promised amazing features and operations. We had 3 experience sessions, in person and over video calls. I was promised SMS and Mobile DID and so much more. It was only AFTER I signed the contract did Dialpad start to backtrack on ALL their promises and told me that actually NONE of the key items are available and can not be delivered. WORST experience ever!!

Review.Titre: terrible user interface and user experience
Review.Contenu: Please, please, save yourself the trouble and find another service. Terrible UI, so many quirks that make it horrible to use.When I send a text, it creates a new line in the dashboard, and I cannot see at a glance who the text was sent to. It doesn't just update the conversation.That is one of about 10 different, terrible UI decisions.

Another bait and switch operator. I chatted in to get pricing for additional minutes, which the operator wouldn't give me. They catch you with a low monthly fee, and then seem to rip you off with a high use rate.

I’ve spent the last several hours on the phone trying to resolve a basic issue and the support team has been terrible. I’m a brand new customer trying to get set up and once you have signed on, paid your annual fee and are no longer interacting with the excellent sales team, go ahead and expect long holds and a support team that is not knowledgeable about their product.

UberConference stinks. I was a 4 year plus customer I am closing my account with them. They make you look an stupid because their system does not work,. They updated their system within the last month (Sept 2019) or thereabouts and its been down hill since then. Their customer service cannot help and appear overwhelmed by the problems.

Review.Titre: Zero customer support - even for paid plan.
Review.Contenu: Sales person sold us the business plan by promising us we could do customization. It appears, however, that what she said we could do was not true. I've been trying to contact customer support and there is a recording that just says that there is no one in customer support available to take our call. Emails and chats go into a black hole.  Worst customer service I've ever experienced.

Audio quality is unreliable, failed multiple times during business calls. Customer service contradictory and email support system does not work.(Asked for a prorated refund via chat support and was told I would get it. Then I got 10 emails asking me to confirm I was still getting the problems. I replied to each one but they didn't see the responses so I had to log on to their chat system again and was then told that they refused to give a refund (even though the service is close to unusable).(Post review update: I was provided a prorated refund.)

This app/program is terrible.  I quit my job due to the implementation of this in conjunction with Service Titan, which we already had.  Yes, part of it is an idiot owner who wants settings that don't work in our work environment, but Dialpad decreased my productivity by more than half.  I can no longer multi task (ie. work on one account in between taking calls) because it attaches all my calls to wrong jobs in Service Titan.  This is good for a call center that does nothing but scripted calls.  This is not good for a small business that has a lot more to do than read a script and fill in the blanks.  Also, 30% of my outgoing calls won't dial out through Service Titan.

Review.Titre: Pray you never need their customer support...
Review.Contenu: The system works for the most part but if there is a problem be ready to figure it out yourself. Contacted customer support many, many times about the same problem.  They never fixed it, I found a workaround but the problem is still there.  The conversations between me and customer support are long so to make a very, very long story short.  They told me the problem was me and would not help.  I figured a way around and now it works but not how it's supposed to work.I would use another system but the whole company is on dialpad and I didn't want to add even more work to this problem by changing to another service.

Review.Titre: They cancel your account without consulting you know even if its not your fault
Review.Contenu: I heard a lot of about dialpad. Heard they were a good service. Don't know if they were paid reviews. Because I just signed up for a trial for my staff overseas to make calls locally. I even spoke to their sales rep about this they said it was ok. Anyways the moment he tries to log in they cancel my account. They don't call me, they don't talk to me, just cancel. Why did they cancel, doesn't say on the email. That's it, follow up or go away. I have to then speak to someone on their chat system to ask what happened and they explained because there was an IP difference. So why cancel my account though? Why not just block access outside of Australia. Then I wanted to lodge a complaint but could not. I can't even have their management know that their customer treatment is appalling.

Review.Titre: Since this only seems to be for 4 to 5…
Review.Contenu: Since this only seems to be for 4 to 5 star review I'm sure mine will never show up. Dialpad is the most frustrating company and application I use everyday. The user interface is confounding. Bugs linger for eons while new features are added. The desktop, smartphone and iPad apps provide great flexibility for how calls are handled but there is NO consistency in design which creates great confusion with me (an Electrical Engineer) and other users. We are a frustrated small company. I can't imagine how a large company could manage the support calls these apps would create. It would be interesting if all the 5-star reviews had some detailed praise. The address book us very limited and separate from the phone's address book.
Absolutely horrible process of trying to remove our numbers from their platform. We have run into 3 separate issues in the span of two months which have been Dial Pad's fault.

Review.Titre: If you want horrible service, Dialpad is for you.
Review.Contenu: We are two months in and Dialpad has been a nightmare. It is a daily struggle to get our calls. They truly seem not to care. They create a ticket and the issues are never resolved.
Lots of hidden fees. $15/month turns out to be $180 then they charge you a bunch of hidden fees. Came out to $256. Had no idea until I was charged. Don't recommend it.

Where do I even begin? First, it's hard to believe all these good reviews are REAL. The business I work with uses Dialpad along with Service Titan, and we've had nothing but issues for the last eight months. Calls are frequently dropped, or a customer suddenly can't hear me when I'm right in the middle of booking their appointment. This happens DAILY. The set up for after hours call routing is confusing and hard to configure. I've had issues for over a week and customer service STILL hasn't resolved them. They continue to talk in circles and do absolutely NOTHING but pass me along to someone else who knows NOTHING and asks me the same questions I've already answered multiple times. And don't even get me started on the phone app. HORRIBLE. All in all, the WORST phone/customer service company we've used. We're switching to RingCentral next week, and I can hardly WAIT.

Dialpad has vision but, no ability to execute. One of my best days is when I canceled my account. Their apps are clunky and poorly designed. It's obvious that groups developing for each device are operating in silos. Features work differently in each app. The only consistency is colors.  I did my best for close to two years deal with this, but what I could not deal with is the unreliable communication platform and substandard support. A major part of the infrastructure is open source and the support people who are based offshore do not have the knowledge or skills to get problems fixed. The *switch* gets mangled so that when I tried to call a customer the call was rerouted to another number. The problem was permanent and could never be fixed. It happened to several contacts. I'm still searching for a visionary VoIP solution that is well designed with a reliable rich feature function menu. Dialpad is not it.
Horrible customer support and experience. Sales were supposed to reach me, but instead of that they just deleted my account out of nowhere...

Review.Titre: very very bad service lot of issues on…
Review.Contenu: very very bad service lot of issues on their desktop app  they can ruin your entire business just avoid them

Subpar customer supportDialpad's tech and marketing talk a big game, and the tech delivers about 95% of the time. But support is awful. The customer success associates are not well informed, slow to answer, and are generally answering questions based on scripts that are haphazardly written. You will get the impression that customer support either:1. Did not read your question/email in it's entirety2. Does not understand Dialpad's processes3. Has never been in a customer support role ahead of this one4. Might not have a grasp on the English language, and may just be copying and pasting 90% of their responses to you5. They are absolutely overloaded and just can't devote more than 20 seconds to your email. We were super excited to work with Dialpad, but the customer support experience is killing that excitement quite thoroughly. We're a new customer (less than 3 months here) - this should be the honeymoon phase of the relationship, but after nearly 100 emails back and forth between my team and customer support, we're pretty much done.

Review.Titre: high costs and unhelpful customer service
Review.Contenu: Not very clear or helpful advice from the customer service team and excessively high costs.

Review.Titre: This is the worst thing in the world…
Review.Contenu: This is the worst thing in the world like why can't it be business and personal.
Very wary. Look at all the positive reviews. All done on the same date. Hmmmmm

We have been using dialpad for around a year now. The software itself is clunky but generally gets the job done, albeit after significant time tweaking everything. We have four desk phones that mostly work, but most features you would expect in a desk phone don't work with Dialpad. We have remote workers, though, which makes dialpads decentralized system a fairly good for for us.What really makes the software unusable is the support behind it. We applied to their latest "startup" offering and got accepted. After a week of back and forth, their general counsel wrote up our license agreement, and we both signed. The day after the contract was executed we got a random email saying they would not honor it and that the multiple employees who dealt with us were not properly trained to extend such an offer. We complained that we already had a contract signed by their general counsel, but they don't seem to care. Our costs will be around $350 more a month than under the contract they are breaking.Now we are in the process of moving to a different provider after having spent many hours configuring everything to their system. Worse, the IP phones Dialpad supports don't seem to be easily configurable to other similar companies.I would recommend against Dialpad. The software is a great idea with terrible implementation and misleading 'support'.

Review.Titre: Poor connection, misleading charges and terrible customer service
Review.Contenu: I run a law firm and all of our advice is given online, with a team that all works remotely. I chose dialpad based on the reviews but have to say my own experience of them didn't match what I had read and ended up cancelling after a few months.Call quality in the UK is not consistent. Ranges from really good to really poor in any given moment. This is not what you need for a business grade system. They also have very poor integrations with CRM's, particularly Zoho CRM. Lastly we use an 0800 number and their pricing is VERY expensive and all minutes rounded up. So even if you spend 1 second trying to connect, you get charged for a minute. I notified them of our intention to cancel the service and we moved to Ringcentral. Whilst waiting for the number to port, despite not using the service, they "topped up" our 0800 calling credit with £100. I did realise this into it was raised by our accounts department. I cancelled our service once the number had ported and then asked them for the £100 credit to be returned as we were not able to use it and nor did we ask for them to top our credit up. They outright refused, stating some small print in their terms and conditions that means you forfeit any outstanding credit when cancelling.That might well be the case, but it highlights their poor customer service where a team of people in Malaysia or some other low cost call center country are unable to apply any discretion or goodwill in order to maintain positive relationships with their clients.If you are in the UK and looking for a reliable provider with good customer service and connections, as well as an excellent integration for Zoho and other CRMs, then I recommend Ringcentral.

Dialpad could improve by firing everyone who answers a phone there and replacing them with test monkeys too dumb to be considered for cancer experiments...any primate with thumbs would be a considerable improvement.I've used their service for four or five months and every call to the so-called support team was a terrible experience. They are rude at the highest levels of that company.I paid for two lines at the annual rate and decided to find a different company after being disrespected repeatedly for asking simple questions about their poorly designed software. Since paying for the year in advance, one might expect a refund for the cancelled months, right? From a reputable company, yes. From Dialpad? That would be a no!When you ignore this review and buy the service anyway, don't expect a refund when you've had enough of the snarky remarks and passive aggressive comments from the children manning the phones over at Dialpad. This is because company policy only allows refunds to be given to those purchasing the month-to-month plans. However, they will do you a solid and escalate your refund request to a supervisor who will never get back to you with a definitive no. You'll figure it out when nothing happens.So, unless you enjoy being treated like a nuisance for not waking up the day after your purchase and having all the knowledge necessary to get the most from their service, DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! Trust me, spend your money elsewhere.

Review.Titre: no nothing wrong just shy about Tuesday…
Review.Contenu: no nothing wrong just shy about Tuesday because i wanted to stay home and i'm sorry females sometimes tuesdays are different but for me i could still stay home when wanted days off still.

Terrible support, it's like pulling teeth to get a straight answer. The answers from support will also change depending on the agent you are connected with. At times you'll have to reference their own docs so that they get on the correct path. Very confusing billing processes. More often than not the invoices do not match the portal. Further, you cannot remove user access and licenses without losing all data associated to that user.

Review.Titre: Used to be easy to chat with support
Review.Contenu: I really used to like how easy it was to chat with Dialpad support by clicking Help and having the option to go straight to a live chat with an agent. It made things a lot more easier instead of being taken to a page where I have to go through Troubleshooting links, and nothing matches my concerns.

Review.Titre: No better than any others - not fit for our purpose
Review.Contenu: This product is not better than any other similar product.  I will say, it is much easer to use than GoTo Connect (avoid!).  Intuitive enough, but could be better.  Its so called link with your contacts database is poor and the support to fix issues is slow (still waiting after 2 weeks for a basic fix).  Its analytics is nothing more than smoke and mirrors, providing no real insights.  Overall, another product that doesn't live up to its own hype.

Review.Titre: Will not let me cancel account
Review.Contenu: The service itself is decent but the customer service is horrible. They will not allow me to cancel my account and continues to charge me despite stating multiple times I no longer need the service.

Review.Titre: Technical support from the company is lacking
Review.Contenu: Technical support from the company has been lacking. I have had problems dialing out and when I called the company they said there was no problem on their end. I lost clients. The issue was resolved months later when my company IT tech said to uninstall the phone app which severely limits my access to dialpad services while traveling. Recently, the desktop app was not ringing in properly and I was missing calls. After my poor experience with several technicians and my last issue I took the time to figure out the problem myself which took several days and many lost calls. When the product works well it's a dream! When it doesn't it's a nightmare and for a small business like mine major issues has financial consequences especially when this is a paid service that doesn't consistently work. The only reason I will renew the contract with dialpad is because it's the only company, that I have found, that is HIPPA compliant. And I have been offered an incentive to leave this review.

We have been with this company for around a month and let me tell you this …Pros:* excellent software * clear voice * AI is very useful * mobile app and desktop app is fluid and works wellCons:* call queue is only available on the pro version ( in fact most useful features are only available on the pro version) * you cannot call and receive calls at the same time under one licence * additional users double the cost of the licence* NO CUSTOMER SERVICE ( no designated customer support number and you only find this out when you sign up)- customer support is only available to enterprises. As a pro customer you are not important and your business means nothing to them .You will have one point of call ( a lady called Charlene who is usually busy in meetings and I get the impression she is the only point of call for the entire uk customer base). She may refer you to customer support if she feels there is a need but this is the only way you will get referred to customer support- if you are lucky enough to get through to her. BASICALLY YOU DO NOT HAVE CUSTOMER SUPPORT !7.6.23. Thank you very much for taking the time to reply . I did what you said and you are right there is a number. However, it has taken me over a month and a somewhat a negative review via trustpilot to get this number and I should not have needed to go to such lengths to get this number. I won’t name her but the sales person who sold me Dialpad and who remained my first and only point of contact up to this point is very incompetent because she was very clear time and time again that there is no customer support for all customers except for the enterprise customers. I am now wondering what else she has misinformed me on. On trialing Dialpad I was given a particular price for the addition of sms and an additional line and a few weeks back when I reached out to add those services they suddenly multiplied by an factor of 3 and I’m now wondering whether these were correctly quoted. I would be grateful if you can either make contact or provide me with contact details so I can call you and double check a few points.
so much wrong, so little help, very limited options overall.  I wish we had gone with another service
Our company was forced to use this by IT to save money. We constantly have dropped calls and when I do connect, it takes up to 45 seconds to hear the customer and for them to hear me. Not a fan.

Review.Titre: I think the dialpad services are great but
Review.Contenu: I think the dialpad services are great.  However, the app does not integrate into my computer very well.  Sometimes it opens on its own, other times it does not.  Sometimes I answer the phone and the person at the other end does not hear me.  I fish around and change things but it is never fast enough or very professional looking.  I am waiting for my computer guru to enlighten me as to why it will not act as transmitter when I answer. I have reverted to using my personal phone for business.

Review.Titre: Dialpad app for macbook is a cancer
Review.Contenu: Dialpad app for macbook is a cancer. It blocks all computers, prevents them from shutting down and doesnt allow you to shut down the app either. I have tried many times to block it out of starting with the start of the computer but it eventually ends up on the allowed apps again. Very very bad

Review.Titre: They say they do contact syncing...kinda, but not really.
Review.Contenu: They say they do google contact syncing, but it only works for direct lines. If you are a team, this won't work for people that call your main number. You will only see the regular caller id for that number.The WIFI to Carrier switching doesn't work well, and you can't disable it.Support is very soso. There is no centralized place to see open tickets, so you are bombarded with emails, because they are really intaking specialists that ask you to do all the work, and then send you unrelated articles, after about 20 exchanges and 2 weeks.

When calling out, no one can hear me. The app will freeze often. Overall its a pain, im grateful to have something to use while working from home but there are so many issues. Hopefully things improve.

Had their VOIP service for nearly 4 years. Not a huge fan of their customer service. They only have agents that communicate via email, and it's never timely. The agents were helpful, but it was just not the best way to receive technical assistance. It would take days to resolve a simple issue. In addition to that, their actual service was never reliable. There would be random times where I wouldn't get notified when a call would come in, or worse, I wouldn't get a call go through at all. There was also a bit of a lag in answering calls.As for their billing department, they nearly cancelled our service because we were short 15 cents one month. They also do not have an auto-pay option available.

Review.Titre: We have several instances of really…
Review.Contenu: We have several instances of really choppy audio.  More than once, we have had someone have to leave Uberconference and come back in.

Review.Titre: I haven't been able to port my google…
Review.Contenu: I haven't been able to port my google number and help has been slow - 24 hours response between questions.

Our organisation reviewed around 4 telephony providers and the demonstration we had from Dialpad was by be far the worst. It was disjointed / unprofessional and the account manager delivering the pitch really did not even know their own product. They couldn't answer many of our relatively basic questions which wasn't at all reassuring. Our stakeholders receiving the demo would have disregarded them as a provider immediately however, luckily for them, our head of IT had used Dialpad at a couple of previous companies and rated it extremely highly. He delivered separate demonstrations to our own internal teams after Dialpad themselves had butchered their presentation. He should have been on commission because he was the only reason we decided to go for it in the end.The product is in fact pretty good whilst at times can be a bit buggy. The transcription service which was the main thing they actually made a real effort to show us doesn't work at all, so we have just disabled it.We've had a few queries / requests after using Dialpad for a period of time - every time we've reached out to our account manager (same person as original pitch) we have just been ignored, or had to chase to finally get an answer weeks later.All the positive reviews on here seem to be outside UK so maybe it's just the UK operation that is poor, as the product is okay. If you want a decent telephony system Dialpad does the job, but if service means anything to you, then I would avoid.

Review.Titre: Good idea, poor customer support, not a terribly user friendly interface
Review.Contenu: My telco arranged for this service as an interim solution.We started on a 14 day trial.But we never received a notification that the trial was about to end, (I guess we should have diarised this) but then we were left without phone/telecommunications during business hours.I tried to log into the account to upgrade and pay, I couldn't log in. It just kept returning me to the login screen.When I spoke with online chat, they said that the account was cancelled.When I said I needed to gain access they said their billing people were gone for the day!!! :-OI said this wasn't good enough I was transferred to someone else who managed to get the account reactivated so I could log in and upgrade, which I did.The user interface doesn't really make that much intuitive sense to me (at least not from a desktop). You have to ferret around looking for options and then having to drill down and back up when you don't find them.I have also had prior online chat experiences that were variable in quality and effectiveness.The other factor is how strong your internet connection is overall as this is a voip system which required good internet. If you're not savvy in the slightest then don't use this service. If you have a little bit of know how, be prepared to have to spend time understanding how it works.

Review.Titre: I wanted a transcript of the chat but…
Review.Contenu: I wanted a transcript of the chat but didn't get one and it disappeared before I could copy and paste it. Not a good experience. But the agent was great.

Review.Titre: Updated 7-26-23 after Dialpad responded to this review
Review.Contenu: UPDATE as of 7-26-23 - I am amending my 1 star to 3 stars as after posting this review Dialpad was extremely responsive in addressing my issues after going back and forth with my CSM and their contract team for over 2 months. They made some strong concessions in an attempt to honor our original agreement from last year when we upgraded our contract.We are continuing to work with them and I have no complaints about the product itself. It is awesome. However I would still warn others to read their contracts closely before signing up.---------------------------------------Watch out for the bait and switch and read your contracts closely. We have been happy with our experience with them up until this year. Have over 30 users on their platform and spend thousands with them. Never have I ever worked with a tech platform that will allow you to upgrade a users seat type BUT refuse to allow you to remove their old license. Forcing you to pay for 2 licenses for the same users even AFTER their sales rep sold us on the ability to add seat types to lock in lower pricing but NEVER mentioned we would not be allowed to remove the old seat type. CRAZY, they are going down hill fast, stay away!!!!

Support was responsive, and I think they did all they could really on tracking down the issue. Could be better on trying to come up with a temporary fix.  If voicemail is down in this instance, is there anything else we could do?  I wasn't really sure on my end.

Review.Titre: 5 star is typical but this is as of lately
Review.Contenu: Typically your service would get a 5 star service, add on the pandemic constraints with over burdening and I would give you 6 stars. However in the last 2 weeks, service has had static, calls dropped and other issues. I still do plan on continuing to use, just hope that it returns back to the excellent service.

Review.Titre: Great for the price, good overall.
Review.Contenu: We've had a few hiccups with calls dropping, so we still use the virtual meeting program we used before joining Dialpad. However, this is still a great service for the price. We especially love the fun hold music and the other interactive features. Another thing I love is that anyone with a Dialpad account can create a meeting, whereas with the program we primarily use, it's locked to just a few accounts.

Review.Titre: works well, but with one big caveat
Review.Contenu: In general, I like UberConference. Performs well, and support is good. But I just learned something that is troublesome, and everyone should know. UberConference allows ANY PARTICIPANT to mute any other participant. That's nuts. Muting should be the responsibility ONLY of the organizer. Goodness knows what the UberConference designers were thinking of when they allowed this. This allows any random invitee to screw up the whole telecon.

Dialpad gets the job done. It does get a lot of spam calls throughout the day but other than that it performs well. There have been some glitches, and after a restart everything is running smoothly again.

Review.Titre: I would like to have multiple contacts…
Review.Contenu: I would like to have multiple contacts on same call - conference call - down load on home computer, when I am working from home, I can answer on computer.
I've used the system several times and my client calls have been dropped during conferencing. The connection seems to be unstable. I also don't like the browser limitations.

Review.Titre: I loved a ton of things about Uber…
Review.Contenu: I loved a ton of things about Uber conference, but the reality is, every client had a hard time connecting because of the variation between mobile and desktop connection, etc.

Review.Titre: Everything is great for the price…
Review.Contenu: Everything is great for the price except for one issue I face sometimes. The phone doesn't ring but shows a missed call. Apart from that I think it's a nice service!

Review.Titre: I have used Dialpad for 2 years
Review.Contenu: I have used Dialpad for 2 years. It is really user friendly and great for companies. I would not use it for large call centers.

Review.Titre: First connection had a lot of static
Review.Contenu: First connection had a lot of static, reconnected good

I like the freedom that this company offers, however, the navigation is fairly tricky. It's hard to differentiate incoming and outgoing calls, texts, etc. I don't believe it's mobile-friendly. I have the number on my website so ill try to adapt for now. I will say that customer service is always available. That's a pro.

Review.Titre: not as good as it seems
Review.Contenu: The phone apps are often glitchy and frustrating to use.  There is no automatic call recording on individual lines so when you transfer someone to another employee the call recording stops unless they remember to turn it on.  Admin can't access call recordings on individual lines. You can't bulk download your recordings making it extremely difficult when an employee leaves

Review.Titre: In my brief experience with this phone
Review.Contenu: In my brief experience with this phone, I've discovered it is very difficult to keep the transcript off of the screen I'm trying to see while talking to the person on the phone. I can't move the little box anywhere on my screen so I can see it, it's either in the upper left hand corner or maximize it and pull it down to the bottom. It won't stay there, it keeps popping back to the top. I haven't gotten that many calls yet, but that is the thing that sticks in my crawl...

I love everything Dialpad has to offer and it has definitely helped our business in being able able to weed the slackers out. I give 3 stars because set up and transition was not as easy as described. I will say that their tech support is great thou. Dialpad is a little pricey too.

There are many features of dialpad that are extremely useful for a customer service team. For example, I can have a group of users assigned to a number and ring all of those people when someone calls. People can be easily added and removed to the call group. What I don't care for is the call quality. There are delays that are disruptive to the flow of a call.

The experience of DialpadMy experience with Dialpad is generally pretty good. It functions well most of the time, and I love the connection to Salesforce and its ability to pull contacts from that.However, I do find the delays in the service are sometimes more common than I would like, and the line can be very crackly at times.

Service is rather spotty. The desktop app is prone to freezing and randomly disconnecting from my mic and headphones. I end up taking quite a few calls on my phone app due to this. The phone app is spotty as well - sometimes it takes AGES to connect and make the call, and sometimes the call goes through immediately but has no audio. It's rare that I make a call from the phone app and it works perfectly on the first try. And it's even worse when an update rolls out - that just makes things all sorts of wonky.

Review.Titre: Good service at reasonable price, but some support and admin issues
Review.Contenu: Service works well at a reasonable base price. Admin console could use a lot of updating so that admins are able to make more changes without having to email into support. Recently started charging for held/unused numbers on accounts and didn't communicate costs until after we were charged.

App issuesI have problems where I cannot disconnect the calls, regardless of where I am using it, the website, or the desktop. Also will be great to set up the recording of the calls automatically instead of activating it individually for each

Really like the platform; allows fast way for users to connect by phone and online. Generally really pleased with it. However, sometimes the Google Calendar plugin does not function correctly, it stops broadcasting the screenshare, or the screenshare freezes for the viewer.

Review.Titre: Dialpad is great if you are operating…
Review.Contenu: Dialpad is great if you are operating on a budget.  The only drawback I have is that its not stable all the time.  It will go down when you least expect.  The sound quality can fade once you answer.  But its great if you are on the road and need to keep up with calls.

Review.Titre: Good customer service, some connection quality issues.
Review.Contenu: Very good customer service, feel like they really care. That being said, I do often have connection issues on my calls. Understandable as the service is reliant on a good internet collection, but that is what is stopping me from marking my rating higher.

Dialpad had issues connecting to 049 numbers in Belgium, which is operator Orange, from our company's Belgium Customer support channel. - My original ticket included ONE OTHER number and the first support person only tested that and said "it is invalid yes. most probably 493, 495, 497, 498 are also not active numbers. I don't see any problem with her account" - Then Nicole W Came through and actually tested this, fixed the issue and made it work! She's a star! This whole ordeal took 4 days. I do not applaud the lazy first worker Rand, who should be getting training on what his job is.The only reason they got 3 stars is because of Nicole, who would have gotten 5 stars if I could rate only her performance.

I use dialpad for work, and it works when I need it to but sometimes notifications do not coming through on my phone which can cause me to miss calls etc. I would prefer if the integration with iphones was a bit better. Otherwise, it works well.

Review.Titre: Dialpad Takes the Telephone back 25 years
Review.Contenu: Dialpad isn't a fully developed application.  Constant dropped calls, terrible customer service, sales reps have no idea how to describe new features.  Overall, wouldn't use this if I didn't have to.

Review.Titre: Every time it updates it puts shortcuts…
Review.Contenu: Every time it updates it puts shortcuts on my desktop and the icon disappears from the system tray and I have to put it back to visible.Inability to share screens like Skype, Webex, or Uberconference.

Review.Titre: I really wish that our customer service…
Review.Contenu: I really wish that our customer service reps that answer the phones could see who the other reps are on the phone with.  Right now, they cannot see which customer they are on with.
